inn1.comm: Rightaway some movement. Landed on the length, around off and middle, came back in to trap Imran Nazir on the left thigh.
Gets squared-up a touch as the ball held its line after landing on the off stump line, he manages to push it away to the off side
again honing on the off stump line, Imran goes back, gets behind the line, turns it to on side

Gone! Pollock locks Nazir with a nip-backer and produces a edge. Lands on a length, outside the off stump and it jagged back in. Nazir drove at it loosely, didn't expect it would come back so much and ended up driving outside the line. Gets an inside-edge and it flew to left of Boucher who pouches it safely. Pretty smart catch. First blow to South Africa. Remember they won the toss and put Pakistan to bat under slightly overcast conditions.
This one lands in the zone outside off and veers away. Younis covers the off stump and lets it go through to Boucher
this one comes back in, Younis is behind the line, pushes it out to the on side, Pollock goes across to make the stop. Sucessful beginning from him.
beaten! Not the usual Ntini angle. This one held its line after landing outside off stump, on a length, and Akmal ends up pushing down the wrong line. He thought the ball would come back
similar delivery and this time Akmal guides it, bat away from the body, to thirdman region

hits the deck back of length, outside the off stump and jags backs in. Younis is cut into half. He doubles up as the ball nips back in, has a stab at it but the ball evades the defensive blade and thuds into the thigh pad. Good start from the seamers under helpful conditions.
this one comes back in but was pitched well outside off and Younis shoulders arms
Ntini continues with his variation. Takes this one away, slightly, after landing outside off, again Younis has it covered, lets it go past him
comes back in from outside off, tucked to Prince at square leg
around the off stump, Akmal gets right behind that and pushes it out to point region. No chance of a run.
fuller and outside off, exaggerated leave from Akmal. There is bound to be some movement in the initial overs.
beaten! Lands just outside off and straightened, Akmal plays inside the line and the ball shaves past the outside edge.
this one moves away after landing in the corridor, no problem in leaving this one.
back of length, outside off and comes back in a touch, Akmal pushes back and offers a dead bat
And again. Full face of the blade in defence. Another tight over comes to an end.
Ah! the usual Ntini nip-backer. Younis tries to tuck it on side, misses and is rapped on the thigh pad
gets behind this one and pushes it out to cover region. Two balls have come in, where would the next one be?
Slightly fuller, again comes in, Younis pushes at it, gets a inside-edge which takes the ball past square leg. He is off the mark.
short of length, comes in slightly from outside the off stump - all deliveries in this over have nipped back in, pushed to point
fuller, honing in on the off stump, Akmal is caught in the crease, this one holds its line, pushed tentatively to extra cover
another one that shapes back in from outside off, defended off the back foot
rapped on the pads! Going over leg stump. Lands on a good length, outside off stump and cuts back in, Akmal's bat comes down the wrong line and is struck on the thigh
first stroke of intent and confidence. Short of length and outside off stump, Akmal goes back to punch it to point
And again. Akmal looks comfortable when the ball is pitched short of length. Its when its on a length, he is caught a bit at the crease. Going neither forward nor back
on a length this time, just outside off and goes on with the line, Akmal stays where he is but he has picked the line and hence shoulders arms
Further away from off stump and hint of shape away, left alone
closer to the off stump, Akmal lunges forward, opens the bat-face, steers to point. End of a maiden over.
Full and straight, on the off and middle stump line, driven back to the bowler
short of length, outside off, Younis guides it to right of gully where Kemp makes a diving stop.
On the off stump line, from short of length, punched to cover region

produces the nick but it falls short of second slip! Lands on the length, just outside off and holds its line. That straightening has Younis in trouble and he pushes at it inside the line but with soft hands and the ball drops just short of Kallis and rams into his left leg before bounding away for a single
beaten! Super delivery. Landed in the zone outside off, on a length, and veered away. Akmal is sucked into chasing it and is lucky not to edge it.
Changes keep coming. Almost constantly! This one nips back in, Akmal hops up, punches at it and gets a inside edge to the on side
Pollock continues to tease Akmal. This one moves away, Akmal tries to withdraw his bat away, but ends up guiding it, along the ground, to the slip
well outside the off stump, Akmal reaches out for it, trying to force it away but it was too wide for him
back to regular programming. On the off stump line, defended off the back foot.
ooh! beaten! Fuller, sucking Akmal forward, before it left him. Pollock is locking up Akmal. The camera pans to Akmal. And he is smiling. As if to say that was too good for him to even edge it.
leans forward, gets right behind the line and defends.
fullish, outside off and shapes back in, Younis gets behind that one in a hurry and defends
jabs at a length-delivery around off, it rolls in front of him, Younis takes a couple of steps forward as if he wants a run, Ntini charges at him and he gets back.

Akmal's dismal time continues. He slips in the middle of the pitch and can't get back. Younis pushes a length delivery towards cover and Akmal rushes across like a express train. Younis is no mood to catch the train, he stays rooted to his station and Akmal has to turn back. He does but slips and falls. Gets up but by the time Gibbs had swooped in on the ball, sees that Akmal is just trying to get on his feet, and so runs with the ball towards the non-strikers end. And when he gets near, he underarms a direct hit and Akmal is well short of the crease.
the probing line around off continues. Younis pays respect by defending it to the off side
from wide of the crease, fuller and on middle and off, pushed to the off side. The strangling line continues from SA
beaten! Good toss to win. Again bit of movement and this one shapes away slightly in the corridor outside off and Younis is beaten as he pushes inside the line.
Yousuf leans forward to a length-delivery outside off, runs it down to third man region for a single. He is Pakistan's best batsman. How will he fare on this track?
Younis moves forward, towards the line of the delivery, pushes it out to cover region
fuller and outside off - where else does this metronomic Pollock bowls?!, defended off the front foot
whistling through the channel outside off, left alone. This actually came back in but Younis was confident that it had't done enough to pose any threat to his stumps and shoulders arms.
this is on the off stump and so Younis comes behind the line, works it to cover.
In the channel outside off and remains in that zone, left alone. SA apply the chokehold.
just short of length, on the off stump line, Younis stands up tall, punches it past cover
fuller but same line, driven to the off side
on the middle stump line, bending in from off, turned to the leg side
on the off stump, Younis goes back, punches it back to the bowler
Fullish and outside off, still Younis goes back and taps it close on the off side
Good drive but Ntini prevents any run from being taken. Driven back to right of him, he lunged to his right with an outstretched right hand to make the stop.
beaten! Yousuf is sucked into a lame poke by a delivery which landed outside off and moved away. He just about pulls out of the stroke at the end and hence doesn't get an edge.
Pushed to the off side, YOusuf looks for a run, even takes a few steps, Younis is not in a suicidal mood though.
full and on the middle and leg, worked straight to square leg. There was a chance there to pick some runs but Yousuf couldn't beat the fielder
Yousuf breaks free! First boundary comes up in the 11th over. Full and outside off, Yousuf leans towards the line and drives, in the air, through extra cover.

corrects the length, drags it back slightly and on the off stump line, Yousuf guides it to right of Kallis at second slip who makes a half-stop. But the ball doesn't roll away too much away from him, hence no chance of a run.
On the off and middle, pushed to that man at silly mid on
full and outside off, Younis goes back, square-drives it past backward point
Super strike! Caressed away! Slightly short of length, outside off stump, Yousuf leans forward and punches it through the line, past point.
from wide of the crease, full and on the middle stump line, that angle allows Yousuf to work it past square leg
Slap! Now the sluice gates are opening. Slightly. This one is short and outside off, Younis jumps at the lapse and spanks it past cover point
again back of length, outside the off stump, punched through cover point
on the middle stump line, worked to the on side

Pakistan slip deeper into crisis. Now Younis perishes. Fuller and around off stump line, Younis lunges forward - rather is sucked forward by the length, and drives, his bat well ahead of the body, gets a edge and is swallowed in the slips. Abdul Baseer would have just shrugged his shoulder!
Inzy leans forward, ever so slowly, and defends
off cutter on the off and middle, Inzamam shuffles across and plays it to on side.
again that shuffle right across the stumps and he is cramped for room as the ball nips back in from outside off. He jabs at it, gets a inside-edge to square leg
starts off with a off-cutter, bit too short and Yousuf cuts it down to third man for an easy single
short of a good length delivery, pitched close to the off stump line and cutting in. Inzi shuffles across a bit and defends it down on the off side
another off-cutter, bit to straight on this occasion and Inzi taps it away towards midwicket, early call and they scamper through for a single
in the channel outside the off stump, Yousuf stays back and steers it down to third man.
forced away off the back-foot, straight to the fielder at midwicket
on the middle and off stump line, no width offered and Inzi i made to play straight. Hall starts off with a decent over
good length delivery on the middle and off stump line, defended watchfully

amazing! good length delivery outside the off stump and Yousuf drives it away towards cover, de Villiers moves across to his left in a flash and stop the ball with a full length dive, and he was in position to have a go at the bowler's end if necessary - all in the span of one second.
defended outside the off stump
another tight delivery and Yousuf taps it away on the off side
clipped away off the pads, get it well in front of square leg and they scamper back for the second
tight delivery to end the over. Yousuf is made to defend
on the middle and off stump line, worked away off the back-foot to the midwicket region

short of a good length delivery, another wicket to wicket delivery - Inzi shuffles across a long way, looks to tuck it away fine but fails to make contact and the ball rolls away off the pad. Inzi was interested in the single but Yousuf rightly sends him back
good length delivery outside the off stump and Inzi punches is into the gap between mid-off and cover
worked away off the back-foot to the midwicket region, quick single taken

another brilliant stop and this time it's Ntini doing the Jonty act. good length delivery and Inzi drives it straight down, Nitni moves in from short midwicket, dives across full length and cuts off a certain boundary
on the hips, turned to square leg
Again SA show their strength in fielding. Full blooded drive from Yousuf and Langeveldt goes down to his left to make the stop. After all who is the fielding coach?
Yousuf is constantly looking to come forward. Drives this one to mid-off but he can't get his placement right in this over so far.
short of length, outside the off stump, steered to point
around off and middle, tight line and Yousuf respects it by pushing it back to the bowler
short of length, outside off, Yousuf tries to cut, ends up pushing it to point. Drinks break.
full and on the middle and off, Inzy launches forward, drives but doesn't get much power behind that and it rolls towards mid-on
nice looking drive but can't pierce the field. Hall offers one full and outside off, inviting a drive, Inzy obliges and drills it straight to cover
Punched away! Slightly short of length and outside off, Inzy leans forward and knifes it through the line past cover
fuller and just around the off stump, comes back in a touch, driven back down the track
Inzy continues to look positive. Good move. Again he is forward, drives a full-length delivery to mid on
heaved away! Super strike! Just leans forward, gets his left foot across, fetches a fullish delivery on the middle and off and swings it behind square leg.
Yousuf takes the Inzy route. Shovels a fullish delivery on the off stump line to right of mid-on, in the air but safe. He didn't quite middle it but will get a single.
full and on middle and off, Inzy shuffles across, drives towards mid off
drags back the length, short of length, on the off stump line, Inzy was looking to come forward, arrests that movement, stands up tall, punches it out to cover
drifting on the pads, worked to right of square leg where Peterson moves across quickly to make the stop
pushed to point
on the middle stump line, full and straight, defended off the front foot
Classy! Leans forward to a full delivery on middle and leg stump line, head over the ball and on drives it through wide midon area.
similar line, this time the bat-handle rotates that much more in Yousuf's hand and the on drive ends up at midwicket

Huge strike for South Africa. Pakistan lose their best batsman. Teasing line outside off and Yousuf tries to guide it through vacant slip region, ends up steering it straight to Boucher. Pakistan in a hole here and that hole is constantly getting deeper.
Slip moves in for Malik. This one is full and just outside off, Malik leans forward to defend
On the off stump line, defended away to the off side
on the middle stump line, turned to the on side.
around the off stump line, punched to the off side.
creamed through covers! Full-pitched outside off, Inzamam leant forward and drove it past a diving Kallis
slightly slower, off cutter, on the off stump line, Inzamam shuffles across, pushes it out towards cover point

bit of extra bounce! Kicked up from a length, Inzamam was leaning forward and adjusted to that bounce by taking his bottom-hand off the handle, and stood up tall, and tapped it to the off side. Very well played in the end.
no surprise this time, on the off and steered to point
is squared up a touch as he shuffles across and then wants to work it to on side. The ball holds its line on middle stump and he ends up pushing it down the track
fuller and well outside the off stump, Malik eases forward, drives uppishly through cover
in the channel outside off, left alone
steered away; Full and outside off, Inzamam moves towards the line, opens the bat-face and guides it past point
honing in on the off stump, Malik gets right behind the line and offers a perfect forward defence

almost holed up in covers. Almost run out as well! Slightly slower, full and well outside off, sucking Malik into a uppish drive and it falls just short of cover. Malik wants a run, Inzy is not greedy and Malik just about gets back. The throw didn't hit the sticks anyways
again that nasty bounce has Inzy in trouble. Kicks from a good length and catches  the shoulder of the bat as Inzy pushes forward and it flies past first slip, down to third man
why bounce it from a length, let me try a bouncer says Langeveldt and hurls a short-pitched one across. Malik ducks under to evade.
short of length, on the off stump line, pushed to Gibbs at point
Pakistan continue to drift. Another one pushed straight to point.
comes in from outside off, Malik leans forward to defend.
around the off stump line again, Malik offers the full face of the bat in defence.
full and outside off, hint of inward movement, Inzamam covers the off stump, gets behind the line, drives to cover
back of length but Inzy comes forward nevertheless and punches on the up to cover point
slightly slower, scrambled seam there, well outside off - Kallis has been trying this delivery once or twice every over, driven to cover
strays on to the pads and Inzy punches it through the vacant midwicket region for a couple of runs. Fifty up for Pakistan. Slow and they have bleeded four wickets.
on the off and middle stump line, defended back to the bowler
short of length and outside off, guided to thirdman
back of length, comes in from outside off, Inzamam stands tall, pushes it to cover
slightly slower, offcutter on the off and middle, Inzamam goes back, is made to wait for the delivery and dead bats it away
on the middle and leg, Inzamam shuffles across, stops his movement, and flicks it to square leg
short of length, on the off stump line - South Africa continue to hit that line consistently, pushed to point
Ah! Spoke too seon. This one was served up short and wide, spanked past point. Bit of rubbish from the bowler and Inzamam thrashed it away
full and straight, on off and middle, defended away to the off side
full again, on the middle stump line, Malik tries to work it to right of mid on but doesn't quite manage to pick the gap
outside the off stump, no shot offered.
fuller and closer to the off stump, Malik leans forward - he looks to be in great balance, drives to mid-off
full and outside off, Malik glides forward, opens the bat-face, pushes it out to cover
on the off stump line, pushed to the off side
bit of extra bounce again, from a good length, Inzamam stands up tall, and pushes it out to point
Biffed away! Wow! Too short and outside the off stump, Inzy fetches it from there and pulls imperiously over deep square leg.

similar length, slightly fuller maybe and  well outside the off stump, Inzamam shapes to pull but sees that it is wider than the previous one and ends up just helping it, swatting it down to the ground to the on side.
leans forward to a fullish delivery outside off and defends
on the hips, tucked past square leg to the man at the deep
beaten! In the channel outside off, Malik goes flirting
drifting towards middle and leg, worked to midwicket
full-pitched outside off, driven to sweeper cover. Inzamam is looking pretty fluent out there. Constantly looking to come forward
Flicked away! Nice stop by Hall. Strays on to the legs, clipped away to fine leg where Hall moves to his right and makes a diving stop
again bit of nasty extra bounce from a good length. It has happened on a few occasions now. Inzy fends it away to the off side.
on the middle, coming in, tucked past square leg.
on the middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
again drifts on to the pads, Hall has been off line this over, flicked through midwicket
corrects his line, gets it outside off, but the length was short and Malik runs it down to thirdman
full-pitched, on off and middle, driven to cover
Full and drifting on to the legs, tries to flick it away, runs off the pads
hits the deck hard, short of length, on middle and off, Malik goes back to defend
fuller, on a length, around middle stump line, Malik pushes it towards mid-on.
slightly slower, outside off, Malik quickly comes forward, taps it to mid-off -man standing deep there, and will get a single
slower one, Inzamam picks it up, pushes it down the ground to cover
comes back in from off stump, Inzy moves back, bit of variable bounce, the ball stops on him, and he pushes it out to the on side and has a good long look at the pitch. Pakistan are 73 for 4
on the legs, easily clipped away to long leg.
skids off the turf, around off stump, pushed out to cover region
banged in short, on the off stump, Inzamam stands tall, and pulls it away. Like swatting a fly.
again Hall drifts on to the legs - the theme in his last two overs, Malik likes it there, clips it past square leg.
Thwack! Full in length, just outside the off stump, Inzamam thrusts his left foot out and biffs it over mid-off.
full and straight, Inzy drives but can't beat Hall.
on the hips, worked past square leg for a single. Pak 81 for 4.
strangling line around off stump continues. Inzamam is forced to pay respect.
fuller and on the middle and off, Inzamam turns it to midwicket. The bat-handle rotated in his hands there, he was looking to drive bit straighter than that.
Here comes the slow and well outside off delivery from Kallis. Inzamam picks it early, goes down on his knee and drills it to deep cover
on the middle and leg, squirted to midwicket
will keep the strike with a dab to thirdman.
Kemp gift-wraps a boundary. Fullish and down the leg side, tickled away fine

What a tame way to go! Another piece of rubbish down the leg side -full and on the legs, Malik tries to tickle it away again, instead send it right into the big gloves of Boucher. Don't tell me , this was a plan from Kemp, I would be gobsmacked.
on the off stump line, pushed to point
drifts on to pads, no luck for Kemp this time! runs off the pads to square leg region
full and straight, on middle and off, turned to on side. AB de Villiers  fires in a direct hit at the striker's end, Inzy puts his bat in time, and they get a overthrow off the rebound
Again Kemp slides one down leg side. Hmm ....
full and on the off stump, Razzaq shuffles across to defend it to cover region
on the middle and leg, worked to square leg
full, right up there around off stump, Razzaq is caught up in the crease, pushes at it and gets a inside edge to the on side
full and outside off, driven to cover point
on the middle and leg, tucked to square leg
just outside off, punched to point
Inzy eases forward, reaches out for a fullish delivery outside off, drives to left of mid on

Almost a mix-up. Full-pitched on the middle and leg stump line, Razzaq flicks it to right of AB de Villiers and sets off for a run. "Ya Ya!" was his call. Inzamam either didn't hear him or chose not to hear him. He remained at his position and saw de Villiers dive to his right to make a great stop. Razzaq turned back and gets back in time to beat the throw
run down to third man

shuffle lands Inzy in trouble. Lands on the middle stump line, shapes back in, Inzamam tries to work it to on side and is rapped on the pads. Going down legside, not sure whether he got a nick, the appeal was turned down.
turned to AB again, no run

Kallis nails the leaden-footed Razzaq. Pitched on a good length, outside off and came back in, Razzaq was glued to his crease, just waved his bat at it as he attempted to drive and the ball threaded the bat and pad gap to crash into the furniture
full-pitched outside off, pushed to cover
banged in short, Mahmood pulls, along the ground, to long leg
Just outside off, punched to mid-on
full and outside off, pushed to cover
full and drifting in, Mahmood fails to make contact and the ball thuds into the pad, hint of reverse swing? half-hearted appeal turned down. Just missing leg says hawkeye
line and length delivery outside the off stump, defended watchfully

had to take a bus to reach it but he made it in time! slightly short and miles outside the off stump, Mahmood needlessly pokes at it and the edge is snaffled by Boucher. Another one bites the dust. Pakistan seven down and in deep deep trouble here
hmm. pitched on the stumps and this one went straight one, loud appeal for lbw turned down but umpire Tiffin is not interested. Hawkeye says that's out
good length and close to the off stump line, defended
wayward delivery down the leg side, similar to the delivery that got rid of Malik, Naved too goes for it but fails to make contact
pitched up outside the off stump, no real width. Defended on the front-foot
punched away towards cover and a brilliant stop from AB saves runs - what a fielder!
closer to the off stump line, defended on the front-foot
good length and coming in with the angle, Inzi gets behind the line and defends it with a straight bat
pitched up and coming in with the angle, Inzi gets forward and drives it down to mid-on. Mid-off moves across quickly to his left and cuts off the single
another pitched up delivery outside the off stump and Inzi finds the fielder at mid-off

another dynamic stop from AB keeps Inzi away from the strike. Good length and drive hard towards cover, de Villiers dives across full length to his right and cuts it off, not only he made it look simple he was up in a flash and had a go at the bowler's end
Short and wide, slapped to left of deep backward point
lunges forward to a full-length delivery and gets a edge to square leg
run down the thirdman.
offcutter on the off and middle, defended off the front foot
Short of length, comes in from outside off, Inzy goes for a pull, gets a inner edge on to his pads and he bobs in front of him
another inside edge. Comes in from outside off, Inzy stabs at it and gets a nick to his pads
chooses to play with a straight bat this time. Fuller and driven past the bowler, there is a direct hit but Inzy makes it in time. 100 up for Pakistan.
Outside off, slightly short of length, he goes for a cut and is beaten. The ball didn't bounce as much as he expected.
fuller and on the off stump, he leans forward, steers it to point

Ntini cleans up Naved-ul-Hasan. He is not happy with the decision. The ball nips back in from outside off, cuts Naved in half. He stabs at it, the bat brushes the front pad and the ball appeared to have flown through the gap without meeting wood but the finger goes up. Replays suggest there was no bat involved.
on the off stump line, defended off the front foot
Outside off stump, full in length, Inzy thrusts his left foot out, slashes it to thirdman. It will bring Rehman on strike
beaten! angling away from Rehman who has a poke at it
away from the off stump and left alone this time
banged in short of length, on the off stump line, pushed to point
Pollock ends his strangling spell with a delivery through the channel outside off stump.
Full and just outside off, shaping back in, Inzy leans forward, drives to cover
placed to left of cover and Inzy will pinch a single.
left like Jack Russel. Angling outside off, the bat comes inside the line as if he is driving it towards on side but he is actually not playing at it
further up, closer to the off stump as well, steered to point
again sliding away from Rehman who watches it sail right into Boucher's gloves
yorker, on the off stump line, dug out well by Rehman
Wide outside off stump, Inzamam launches himself into it but couldn't reach it.
on the off stump line, full in length, worked to the on side
outside off and Inzy frees his arms and it runs down to wide third man
pushed across Rehman who opens his bat-face, runs it to backward point
short of length and again angling away, Rehman stands up tall and again guides it to point
again steered to point where Gibbs moves to his right to make the stop
full and outside off, driven to cover
full and straight, on the middle, Inzy pushes it past the bowler for a single.
beaten! There are two slips out there and Rehman tries to guide a full-length delivery past them but doesn't get a touch.
full and on the legs, worked to mid on. Rehman yet to get off the mark.
lands on a length, around middle, shapes away towards off, steered to point
whistling through the corridor outside off, Rehman pulls his bat out from the line and lets the ball sail to Boucher
lands outside leg, moves across, tapped to the on side.
on a length, around off and middle, Inzamam pushes it out to cover
on the middle, turned to midwicket
Full-pitched outside off, Inzamam drills it to cover
length-delivery, just outside off, Inzamam forces it to point. Can't peirce the ring though. Two balls to go in this over.
He gets his single with a drive to long on

Gone! banged in short and just outside off stump, Rehman tries to guide it to third man, is cramped up for room and nicks it behind. Another catch for Boucher. His sixth. Rehman didn't wait for the umpire's decision. Walked rightaway. Gilchrist would be happy.
Inzamam refuses to take the single off the first ball. Fullish, outside off, drilled to deep cover. Doesn't want to expose Asif.
thrusts his left foot out and drives straight back to the bowler
full-pitched on the middle and leg, clipped away to right of deep square leg, Inzamam wanted to come back for two but Kallis was quick on to the ball and released it quickly.

cleans him up with a beauty! Landed on the middle stump line, full in length, Asif pushes at it without moving his feet, bat ahead of his body, and it shaped away to crash into the off stump. So we still have the movement off the track. Bit of variable bounce as well.

inn2.comm: Oh ho! starts off with a Harmison special. Way down the leg side. Even if we had three keepers, it could not have been stopped.
Gets his radar right. Full-pitched outside off, driven to mid-off
on the off stump, full and straight, driven to mid on
ambles in, lands one on a length and well outside off, cut straight to point
Not much movement so far. This one drifts on to the pads, tucked past square leg
Creamed away! Overpitched outside off, no movement whatsover and de Villiers drills it through cover
full in length and straight, just outside off, gets behind the line and defends
hint of movement in. Full and landed on middle, shaped in slightly, tucked behind square leg
Full and on the off stump line, driven to midoff
And again.
on the off stump line, going on with the angle, tapped to the off side
sails down the leg side. Wide called.
Full in length, well outside off, Smith reaches out, tries to force it away, doesn't middle it, the ball rolls away towards midon
fuller and outside off, this time Smith finds the middle of the bat but hits it straight to mid off
Whack! Wow! A full-length delivery outside off has disappeared over mid-on. He just leant forward and biffed it over the on side.
on the middle stump line, worked behind square leg for a single
hits the deck slightly short of length, on the off stump and it moves away, Smith stands up tall, punches it down in front of him
on the middle and leg, tapped to the vacant midwicket region. Asif runs across to make the stop.
In the channel outside off, bit more effort into that delivery and it sails past de Villiers who shoulders arms
a bouncer , catches de Villiers by surprise. He tries to go for a pull and is struck on the right forearm
slides one across Smith who steers it to point
length-delivery on the middle stump line has been sent past square-leg
another one on the good length, around middle stump line, turned to square-leg
fuller, on middle and off, skids off the track, de Villiers pushes at it and it runs towards point
Bosh! slightly short of length, forced away through point
jaffa! Landed on a length, around off and middle and shaped away, Smith has a stab, inside the line and is beaten.
hits the deck with a grunt - Asif is running in harder in this over, lands on a length, and shapes away just outside off, steered to point

Smith charges out! He ran down the track, backing outside leg in the process and swatted a short of length delivery on the middle, over cover. Didn't hit the meat of the bat. Looks like he wants to finish this one in a hurry.
banged in short and it sails down leg side.
short of length, kicks up outside off, not much room for a cut but de Villiers opts for it and gets a bottom edge to the ground and it rolls over towards point
another one banged in short of length, outside off stump - there is a man at deep square leg, pulled into the ground and that man comes into play
fuller, on a length, around off stump, Smith pushes it towards mid-off and sets off for a quick single
Now it's Rana's turn to bowl a bouncer. Climbs over Smith's head and he sways away
on a length, around off stump, turned to left of mid-on for a single
fuller, right up there around middle and off, de Villiers drives but takes his bottom-hand out of the handle and it rolls over towards mid on
full and straight, eased to left of mid-on. There is not much movement on view now.
Full-toss. blink. boundary. Driven straight down the ground.
smeared through midwicket. Fullish, on the middle stump line, Smith was confident that there is not much movement happening now, so just leant forward and played it on the length. Across the line.

cuts Smith in half! hits the deck short of length, on the off stump line and it goes on straight, the bat comes down in a strange angle. Almost from the backward point area and the ball squeezes between the bat and pad

Hello! Smith has a mad charge down the track and moves away so much outside leg stump that big fat heave doesn't make contact with the ball that whistles outside off. Asif tries to have a chat with Smith who simply turns and walks away towards square leg. Best not to have a conversation after that kind of shot!
just outside off, kicks up from short of length, stabbed away to the off side
fuller and on the legs, clipped away past square leg
Imperious! Majestic pull through midwicket. Short of length and on the off stump line, he pulled it off his front foot.
on the middle stump line, de Villiers goes back, turns it to the on side and shouts a No! to Smith.
Mahmood skids this one across Smith who pushes it out to point
fuller and on the off stump line, Smith leans forward, opens the bat-face, steers to point
around the off stump line, Smith lets the ball come to him, doesn't reach out for it, and guides it with soft hands, down to thirdman
full and just outside off, comes in a touch, de Villiers turns it to square leg region, looks up at Smith, who responds positively and off they rush across for a single
clubbed away! This time the charge works. he runs down the track and Mahmood tries to follow him and he smears it to left of mid-on
Bouncer and pulled away in air. Ball bounces bit more than he expected and he ends up sking it but squarer and the deep backward square leg fielder has to come across to his right to make the stop.
length-delivery on the middle and leg, pulled away to long leg. Not the length for it but somehow de Villiers manages to unfurl a pull.
on the middle and leg, Smith tries to force it off the back foot, to the on side, doesn't make proper contact and the ball rolls away
slightly short of length and outside off, cut to wide thirdman
Boom! Again not all that short, on the off stump line, de Villers stands on his right feet, left in the air and whips it over midwicket.
fuller and on the off stump line, defended off the front foot
Fullish, on middle stump line, worked across the line to midon
slower one, on leg stump line, Smith waits, turns it behind square leg for a single
on the off and middle, full in length, worked to square leg and again another quick single is taken
on the legs, clipped to deep square leg
slower one, it loops up outside off, de Villiers spots it and goes on a bent knee to cream it but hits it straight to cover. Released from back of the hand.
swatted away! Bouncer down the leg side, not much pace and de Villiers swivels off the front foot and just helps it to fine leg
flighted delivery outside off, pushed back to the bowler. Slip in place.
turns in from outside off, tucked behind square leg with the turn.
wallop! slightly short and straight on the off stump line, de Villiers rocks back to pull it through midwicket region
Look at the white ball fly! he runs down the track, reaches the pitch of a tossed up delivery on off stump line and sends it soaring over long on. super strike!
on the middle and leg, turned to square leg for a single
pushed through a bit, outside off stump, doesn't turn back in and Smith is beaten going for a cut
overpitched on the off stump line, down comes the bat straight, meets the ball flush in the middle and sends the ball back to the bowler
pleasing drive to mid-off. Full in length and outside off, he presents the full face of the blade to it.
slower one - from the back of the hand, outside off, tapped towards gully and they will get a easy single
Slap! Smith rings the room service and Mahmood serves one short and wide, thrashed past point
Carved away! Another charge, another boundary. He dances down the track and smokes a short of length delivery to widish long on.
from round the stumps, drifts one on to the pads as he attempts a arm-ball, glanced away for a single
some turn there. Breaks in from outside off, Smith shapes to cut and then is cramped by the extra turn and pushes it out to point
this time he walks across the stumps so that he can work with the turn and flicks it to behind square leg

dropped by Asif! What's more he gives away an extra run. It was short of length, on middle stump line, de Villiers backs away to pull but gets too much under the ball and it heads towards cow corner. Asif runs from mid-on, reaches it but clangs it. And then he doesn't react quickly and they rush across for another run
cut away! turns in slightly from outside off stump, bit of width there and he carves it past backward point
Murder! Flat-batted heave over long leg. Just leans forward, fetches a full-delivery from outside off and swings it over leg side. South Africa are looting runs here. Daylight robbery!
fuller, hint of swing in, driven to left of mid on for a single. Now Smith on strike. Will he charge down the track again?
Violence! He backs away to the legside - doesn't charge down, and clubs a full-length delivery over mid-off.
50 up for Smith in no time. shuffles across slightly, opens the bat-face and runs it down to thirdman
Now de Villiers reaches his fifty with a dab. Both are having a party out there.

Crash! That booming slap slog does it. South Africa romp home to a 10-wicket win. Smith backed away to leg side and swung a length-delivery over the on side ring. Awesome strike to bring up the win. Both the batsmen had a party out there, none of the Pakistan players were invited to it. Balls disappeared over mid-on, mid-off, midwicket and where not as they bludgeoned 13 fours and 3 sixes.
